meanings.definition: A person who writes or performs farces.
meanings.sent1: The talented farceurs entertained the audience with their hilarious play.
meanings.sent2: The farceurs were busy rehearsing for their upcoming comedy show.
meanings.sent3: The group of farceurs had the audience laughing uncontrollably with their witty jokes.
meanings.sent4: The farceurs were like comedic wizards, weaving laughter into every scene.
meanings.sent5: The farceurs brought the stage to life with their comedic brilliance.

meanings.sent1: We invited the farceurs to perform at our event.
meanings.sent2: The farceurs' costumes were colorful and eye-catching.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous farceurs added a touch of humor to the serious play.
meanings.sent4: The farceurs' performance was a delightful blend of comedy and charm.
meanings.sent5: The audience erupted into laughter as the farceurs took the stage.
